You get graded on 2 midterms, 1 final, and a set of online quizzes. All are worth 25% each. The content taught in class is basic however exam questions are not at the same level. Quizzes are strenuous and the course is not well organized. You HAVE to take notes in class and there are no office hours available. I Would not suggest this professor.

Need to do your two assignments correctly (only P/F), and each 10% I lose 10% for assignment 1, that the reason why even I got good score in every exam, I couldn't get a better grade. Content is always easy, compare to the other Prof in FIC, but you still need to work hard as well. At least, no many students in her class join the cram school.

Vera is very kind and easy to approach. However, her class is different from her exams a lot. If you work hard, I think you will get a good grade. And her class is all hand-writing, it is better to take all classes. Her homework is online and if you do the practice before finishing all the assignments, you will get good marks.

Vera Lantinova is definitely one of the kindest professors Ive met so far. She is quite calm and has a soothing voice (which is sometimes a little bit too low), so listening to her is very pleasant. She definitely knows the subjects she is talking about and she is passionate about them. Definitely taking macroeconomics with her next!
she teach so simple in class and exams oh my God dammnn tough!!!
Her voice is low. You need to take many notes. But her notes are very clear and useful towards exams. She won't give questions beyond what you have learned. Better than expectations.
Her exams were easy. Low voice but really nice.
easy course with easier exams, she voice is so low. needed to pay more attention.

She is extremely helpful, explains very well and gives helpful in-class exercise for practice on what you are learning. her exams are easy/fair, nothing you haven't learned. I would definitely recommend her.
marking is fair, and in my class, 30% of class got A.
wonderful Pro. i took both ECON103 and 105 with her. she marked exams and assignments fairly. class is marked by scale. most people in my class got B

No one in the class understood her...when she asks a question no one seems to answer it "correctly" eventhough her answer is exactly the same as what we said. I totally understood the material and didn't do that well

Gives unnecessary marked quizzes that are very long, huge timewasters that after the first twenty minutes contribute practically nothing to one's learning. Does not teach the class in an effective method and places importance on things she deems important but they really just waste your time. She is respectful.

Grade is split between weekly quizzes (unlimited attempts), midterm, and final. Everything is based off the lectures, she is passionate and entertaining. She always encourages questions and student feedback. Truly one of the best profs I've had. Midterm was easy - MC questions taken directly from quizzes. Final was the same just a little longer.

Marie is a fair grader. Midterms and finals are straightforward if you utilize resources like MyLab and Unstuck AI for study prep. Attendance is mandatory, but the content isn't overly difficult if you put in the work.

Lectures are clear, no recording or filled slides. Tutorials go through textbook example questions, not mandatory but helpful. Midterm was very easy and Final was just double the length. Marie encouraged questions and was always very good at explaining material.

Marie is a great teacher, one of the best for an introductory Econ course. There are no tricks to her class, midterms/final are just what you would expect from the tutorials/lecture material/MyLab questions.
Only downside is that the class grading is all exams. I believe 40% midterm, 60% final (took this class in Fall 2021). Strongly recommend.

She also marked very fairly. Her midterm and final were incredibly fair, stuff is taken straight from homework or in class examples. The content isn't very difficult. I was told that this class was hard but it is really easy if you remotely put effort and practice.

I was told this class is hard, but it isn't. Marie is a great teacher, she explains in a way that is very clear and understandable. The midterm was very fair, I thought it would be much harder. I didn't read the textbook, and she sometimes finishes class early. Some people may find her boring, but to get a good mark go to lectures to understand!
I would recommend going through MyLab problem sets from each chapter consistency. The lecture slides are a good summary of the formulas and graphs.

The way that Marie teaches the class is not for everyone. I personally really liked the class structure because I could (and did) skip going to lectures, tutorials and literally just read the textbook before every exam and scored decently

If you want to get through 103 with minimal effort and time, I suggest taking it with Marie over Doug Allen.
Overcomplicates lectures. Easy class if you know how to think.

Only graded on best midterm out of 2, so she takes the best one. midterm is 40% and final is 60%. No homework and tutorials are suggested but not mandatory. Get mylab and grind it. Curved my calculated final from 45 to a C.

Explains concepts well, but does not provide any study materials unless you pay for her study plan. I would recommend just reviewing and rewriting class slides, as well as paying attention to lectures and watching some videos on course subjects. You'll be alright if you can stay above average.
Good prof to talk to, lectures weren't the most interesting but she was very fair with her tests.
Horrible class
Overall really difficult course and your grade is completely reliant on who your TA is but Rekkas is really approachable and gave good study tips

no assignments, just graded on midterm and final, both were very hard, esp the final. don't bother coming to lectures cuz rekkas just reads off of slides. exam questions were very different from practice questions on mylab and were very difficult. the final was so rough I have ptsd from it.

Class is 40% midterm and 60% Final All MC, If you like this format, I would definitely recommend taking the class with Marie. Exams are based of past exams and MyLab Questions, If you grind those out then the tests are pretty easy. Compared to the other teachers, Marie is a good choice.

I heard that Douglas is hard on tests so I chose Marie. But she teaches badly and just read off the slides which seems like she didn't prepare for the lecture just do it year by year. For our final, she gave us 80 questions and we only are given two hours to finish. I do not understand what is her problem.
2 midterms, the highest one is worth 40%. The Final is worth 60%. Slides are a summary of the textbook. Do my lab questions and the practice tests posted for review and you should do okay.
Great professor. Pay attention and you'll learn a lot.

Everything - lectures, homework, exams - is from Pearson. I only attended the class on the first day and on exams, and never went to any tutorials. Just read each chapter in the book and do the quiz every week. The exams are all MC and closely match with the textbook. Very forgettable experience, maybe this class is too low-level for her to care.

40% midterm/ 60% final. No participation, no assignments, no mandatory attendance. Had 125 multiple choices in 3 hours for the final, questions are not too hard if you actually read her notes but with exam stress, 125 is A LOT to take in. Nice person though, lectures are a bit boring as she just reads of the slides.

She's honestly such a great prof and teaches things very clearly. Doesn't spend extra time, just quickly gets to the point. Gives lots of good examples and is great at reiterating and explaining things to you if you ask. If youre confused see her after class, it helps!! Only complaint is that there were only two exams and they were really hard

marie's rly nice! lectures r fun but i nvr paid attention & on tests it was like "what was mentioned in lecture" so i lost marks. she understands the plight of students so let me to share expensive mylab costs with 9 other people & it's helpful practice. she hates academic dishonesty & is strict on that. khan academy helped for this class
Had her for ECON 103. Mark was based off purely a mid term and a final. 40 percent and 60 percent. She often skins through power points really fast. Not bad overall

She is a fine professor, nothing special. At times it is hard to follow along but in the long run the course it relatively simple. My mark wasn't the best because there is only a midterm and a final, and I messed up on the midterm. So no room for making mistakes, wouldn't take a class with that heavy of exams again. Overall Marie is a fine prof.

The lectures were planned out well enough, but the professor didn't seem to know what she was talking about at times, and felt like she lost interest in her teachings throughout the semester. Her explanations aren't very clear, and she goes through the slides very quickly.
She never answered anyone's raised hands :/

She is very passionate about her work, and isnt afraid to share her opinion. She feels strongly about her beliefs, yet remains objective. Generally a thorough lecturer, but can be confusing at times. Tests are hard, but reasonably fair. However, the final was 20% longer than she claimed, with no time extension to match. Luckily it was all curved.
serious class with a serious prof. don't be afraid to ask her questions. she's super smart and committed.
tough course, tough tests good prof. she teaches you what you need to know and you have to take the time and effort to go outside the course material to do well on the tests and the exams.

She's a great prof, she gets right to the point and is efficient. Midterm was easy, final was brutal (150 MC questions all calculations). She reads off slides (ava on canvas) and goes into detail. Barely went to tutorial, it was useless our TA was no help. If you are self-motivated and good at teaching material to yourself, you should do fine!

Took ECON103 with Dr. Rekkas. She's funny and engaging and makes econ (which is quite a dull subject) bearable. Her classes are graded based solely off a midterm (40%), and a final (60%) and they consist of 100+ MC questions (which I prefer). Her exams are difficult if you aren't fond of MC, and you will likely find yourself pressed for time.

Boring lecture, read out from the slides. Contents are straight from the textbook. Useless tutorials. Gave 125 questions for the final exam involving many calculations. Past exams and MyEconLab were not helpful in preparing.
rekkas don't wreck us. she's a good prof.
MR is an excellent lecturer - easy to follow and fair in her tests.

dr. rekkas' class isn't like the other courses where it is painful to sit thru the class. she keeps her lectures relatively brief, they are efficient, she does the topic in a good manner and brings the material to life. she starts, she finishes, and that's the class. no complaints.
great professor and outstanding academic. she sets the bar high for the class. the course is not for people who won't study. SFU's best professor.

She makes sure to explain the important concepts in class and leaves you to study the details. I have a short attention span so I really liked her quick and effective teaching style. For Econ 103, spend more time practicing and less time reading the textbook.

Super unorganized, rush through lectures all the time, all of her lecture slides are ripped off from textbook word-by-word but the way she explains it makes it even vaguer than the textbook itself. Midterm and final are all MCs but are very challenging. Got an A+ all based on self-studying through the textbook, her lectures are useless for me.

Nice, but she tells you from the start that this class will be graded on the curve. Depending on if the class does well or not on the midterm, she will adjust the final to reflect that, AKA easy midterm, killer final. She is very nice if you go to her office hours. On a last note, she does rush through lectures sometimes, so beware of that.

Hard midterm, really hard final. Told us that one of the goals of the final exam is to test our ability to take tests. Her teaching style is average. Conveys the material exactly the way the textbook does, given that the slides are ripped straight from the textbook. Got final grades up pretty quick though so good job on that.

Marie Rekkas is by far the best professor I've had at SFU. I retook ECON 103 with her and absolutely loved her. She unlike most profs actually cares about her students. She tries to keep everything basic and straight to the point and doesn't go off topic. Her midterm was brutal but that's only because she wanted to have a well spread average!
she just reads the textbook. And makes it even more confusing then it is originally.

She's an okay prof, but reads off Powerpoint slides which are ripped straight from the textbook word for word and uploads them to canvas each week. Homework is a bunch of online quizzes which are an easy 20%. Midterm and final are all MC. The midterm was fair and the final was not fair whatsoever, probably the hardest exam I've ever taken so far.

Lectures are not mandatory, as Marie reads off the slides that are all available online. All assignments are online through my EconLab and the midterm/final exam is all multiple choice. She doesn't have any marking to do since everything is multiple choice. The midterm was fine, but the final is brutal and she only gives 2 hours for 100 questions.

She gave the most unfair final exam I have ever taken. Only gave 2 hours to finish 100 multiple choice questions, which were so tricky and difficult. She barely goes into detail in lecture, TA called off tutorials, no supervision for this course what so ever, poorly organized. Easy midterm and impossible final..

He got confused and scrambled quite a bit but as long as you pre-read and attend every lecture you will not have trouble with the course. Obviously if you skip class regularly, you are not going to do well. his exams were extremely similar to his practice exams and assignments so you know what you are getting into.

He just wrote on printed out PowerPoint slides (posted online). It was difficult to understand what he said and wrote, he also crossed out stuff, wrote over things, and did stuff wrong constantly. Studied off his assignments and managed a decent mark. I didn't open the textbook or go to lecture often. Genuine guy, just can't teach to save his life.

He's a nice guy, he brought us candy for halloween, but terrible professor. The textbook is useless, it's all in his lecture but lectures are extremely boring. I skipped quite a bit. He mixes things up, and he scratches out what he writes often which makes things confusing, also very unclear. Overall, it was horrible, thankfully I passed though.

His lectures are basically the bare minimum of what you need to learn to do well in this course. Go home, watch youtube videos, read the book, work backwards using the assignment answer keys to understand the problems. I HAVE heard that other Econ profs give much trickier exams, so if you can self teach, you might find this stuff straightforward.

Econ 103 is already a pretty boring class and frank certainly doesn't help. DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE WITH THIS PROF. He is easily one of the worst profs I have had at SFU. Lectures are dull. Look elsewhere for an econ prof.

Terrible Lecturer. Lectures are long, boring and he constantly makes mistakes while explaining concepts. Has trouble answering questions clearly. -Notes are messy and hard to follow -Gives vague and unclear answers to questions -Examples in notes do not cover questions asked in assignments -Assignments are for completion marks which is fine, but they also wont say anything if your answers are completely wrong so keep that in mind if u are using them to study off of
Very confusing with his accent, if you want to fail in econ 103 like most of the class did then go ahead.

Completely boring lectures and extremely unclear. His midterm was really difficult parts of his answer key were wrong as well. If you're planning to take Econ 103, i would recommend looking somewhere else.

this prof is unclear, can't speak clear or understandable english, has HORRIBLE grammar in her notes + misses out words in her sentences, kills you with her note taking + kills u further w/ her midterms + exams.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS.  for real.

you cant understand anything he says. the tutorials are not mandatory. if you study the textbook you will pass but you better know it all. hes lecture slides are good but he basically says exaclty what he wrote on the slides in his lectures. DONT TAKE THIS CLASS. really.

Honestly, take Ghosh for an easy A. The practice midterm was basically the same as the midterm. Most of the questions were directly from the textbook or his notes. No need to attend class, just look through his powerpoints. He is terrible, but the exams are easy.

Lectures can be long and wordy. Attending is a must for weekly quizzes. The material is challenging, but Unstuck AI and the textbook help make sense of the content. Overall, a tough but manageable course.

Ok professor but very easy class. Got by with just reading textbook a few times and doing tutorial questions. highly suggesting avoid taking her and would wait for a better professor to teach this course.

Very unclear professor that is unorganized and over explains concepts when she does not need to. Combined with her thick accent makes it an unpleasant learning experience. Very bad at explaining the material. She makes the class significantly harder than it should be. Extremely aggressive and unapproachable attitude. Do not recommend this class to anyone.
Just terrible

Professor Barking is clearly passionate about ECON and I found her lectures very engaging. Her emphasis on particular concepts during lectures DO show up on exams so I would highly encourage attending lectures and participating. Fair grader for a potentially challenging first year course.

All you need to do is read her lecture notes and understand the gist of it. Attending class will not make much of a difference in your learning. Reading the textbook/youtubing topics will get you a good mark considering her tests are based on material covered in her notes. Solid choice for ECON 103. Her exam questions are pretty fair and her teaching is pretty decent. If you show up to class and take notes, you probably won't need to read the textbook.

I passed this class with almost 100 % and I had never taken an Econ course in my life. That said, it's because I attended every lec, asked lots of Qs, listened to the lecs and went to office hours. To pass this class you really need to stay on top of things. Her exams are always fair but it's a lot of info. Overall, a pretty decent class.

First of all , not a bad person at all, she is quite nice.  But lectures are unclear , she just fails to explain key concepts/steps to solve a problem. I read the txt book and teach the course myself and is way better than going to her lecture, seriously!

Hard material, unhelpful prof. Tries to explain things to the best of her ability, yet just seems to repeat herself. Not a bad person, just not the best prof. Taught myself most of the course from the textbook and study guide. Study guide is SUPER useful

There's no point going to lecture because 1) her accent is so thick you can't understand her 2) all her material is based off the textbook. Course material was taken straight from the textbook so if you miss a class or don't pay attention just read the textbook/lecture slides and you will do fine. The exams are fair and the material is exactly what he taught in class. Best professor I've had at sfu so far and I definitely recommend him!!

nice guy, very friendly and easy to approach if u don't understand material. all material is posted online, he keeps it simple and straightforward, although he does give surprise participation quizzes sometimes. midterms are semi-difficult but if you actually study what he tells you to and do his practice problems you'll be fine.
He's an awesome lecturer! He throws in jokes during lectures to explain concepts, and honestly, he nails it every time.
Yan Yan is super nice and caring. His explanations are helpful if you listen. Tests are super fair, but the class is graded only on 2 midterms, 1 final and a couple of quizzes.
I struggled with math in the middle parts of this course, but now I'm actually thinking about switching from business to econ. Yan made econ so much fun and helped me see it in a whole new way!

I'll admit, I'm trash at anything math related. My grade is due to me not taking the time to understand the concepts. I will say, it's kinda hard to hear what he says. Bit of a thick accent, I thought he was French at first, and his classes were a bit unorganized. Still, he's a generous marker and I agree that he's one of the better Econ profs.

Yan is a very goofy guy, but in a good way. His lectures are kinda boring and he might go on very long tangents but he explains the topics in great detail and basically will cover almost everything. I would definitely recommend Yan, definitely one of the greatest profs I've had.
Definitely a good professor! Highly recommended!
Tests and lectures contents are basically the same, there are no surprise questions. Choose with confidence!
Very good new teacher!

I feel like shes a hit or miss. People either really like her or hate her. I personally couldnt learn anything from her, I could grasp the concepts she was trying to explain. I failed in her class. Retook it with a different prof and got a 85% so Im blaming the teacher lol.

It's true that Iryna and ECON103 is not easy. But I would recommend Iryna. She gives lecture notes in lecture only. But, you'll find that her notes are very good to study off of. She goes over relevant and specific questions in lecture. So don't miss a lecture. Also, she gives previous midterms which are great to study off of.

Iryna wants to overload information into you, as fast as possible. I asked her two questions the whole semester during lectures and she acted like I was wasting her time, so I never bothered to ask again. She was just regurgitating textbook (badly written one) material onto the projector. The dreadful lectures made me feel super tired and bored.

Iryna was pretty clear to understand despite her Russian accent. She made evening lectures a bit more enjoyable with her high energy and light jokes. Her lectures were understandable but the content is extremely difficult to grasp so studying concepts in your own time is a must! The bad part was that your mark relies on 2 midterms and 1 final exam.

Iryna was pretty clear to understand despite her Russian accent. She made evening lectures a bit more enjoyable with her high energy and light jokes. Her lectures were understandable but the content is extremely difficult to grasp so studying concepts in your own time is a must! The bad part was that your mark relies on 2 midterms and 1 final exam!

She has an accent but by no means is she difficult to understand. She cracks jokes here and there and is pretty funny. Explains concepts well and the content isn't too hard to pick up if you are listening intently and actually TRY to learn. Assigns questions from the newest version of the textbook, but the older versions are just fine for reading.

There were only 2 midterms of 25% each and a final of 50%.... She was suuuuuper lazy and terrible.  Only gave us notes without any clear explanations.  Tests were extremely hard with all long and difficult written questions ONLY (no MC).... Overall, lectures look like Grade 1(coz she only read those notes) while exams look like 4th year university.
classes are curved so the average of our class was 46%. exams are tough but if you study you shuold be fine

This is your warning, do not take Econ 103 unless it is a degree requirement (if it is, you might want to rethink your degree). The course is BRUTAL. I was so surprised when I passed (praise be the curve).
Very clear with what she expects but the textbook is useless and most of the practice exams are given without any answer keys. No homework to get any criteria on how you're grasping concepts.

Iryna is awesome. Her lectures are clear and easy to follow, but Douglas Allens book is absolutely useless. The recommended book is so much better. Only 2 midterms and a final, and they are very similar to previous exams so practice all the past exams and you should be fine.

Honestly, Iryna isn't a bad professor. Horrible textbook, but I'd still recommend you to buy BOTH required/recommended b/c 1) better than nothing and 2) there are more practice questions in 2nd one. When reading, skip useless textbook examples and MAKE SURE you get main concepts. She provides past exams with missing answer keys. Exams were fair.

To be honest, Iryna is a fair and good professor. Her class only seems hard because the textbook "economic principles seven ideas for thinking"  by Allen W. Douglas is super stupid, useless and bad. Her lectures help bring the concepts alive from the textbook. She teaches well, and just needs a better textbook selection next time.

She's clear if you listen and take notes of what she says (not just what she writes down) available for help after classoffice hours but not at other times. 1st Midterm was alright, 2nd was harder and final was fair (sets difficulty based on class results). Do the practice exams she sends out and go to herTA for help. Friendly and quite funny
Decent prof with amazing notes. DO NOT BUY THE TEXTBOOK. It is a complete waste of money. Everything you need will be on the notes she gives.
Such a great and helpful professor. Definitely a great prof. Also, she is pretty hot.

Attending her class is mandatory because she writes out her notes on the overhead. Personally I quite like her method because it prevents me from falling asleep. Her midterms/final are fair! (Similar to her past exams) This obviously isn't an easy course, a lot of effort is needed to do well. I'm a student with a 3.3 cGPA and I ended up with a B+.

Terrible professor. Iryna does not use Canvas, she refuses to email you final exam marks and asks you to come in to the one hour of one day in May to view it. SFU, please teach your staff to use technology when we pay $500 for this course. Also, all her notes are handwritten, she is unclear in explaining concepts and often goes "are we ok?".."NO."

She teaches only basic concept and simple example in lecture. And, giving out the past exam. after reading the notes and try the past exam, you would think you know everything. However, the exam will be more difficult level. You will feel like a dumb during exam. Hard exam. Don't read the book. Just do the past exam. You will pass
Retaking it. Enough said.

She's a very good lecturer. Always willing to help and sends out practise exams for midterms and finals. However, this course requires a ton of thinking..to do well, you must have a great understanding of the material. Practise previous exams, know your concepts inside out instead of memorizing and you'll do absolutely fine..!

Iryna was not good at clarifying difficult concepts in the course.  The class average for midterm 1 was 47%. midterm 2 53% and the final was the hardest.  She does not prepare you for the midterms and final at all.  Like the previous poster wrote, you have to study the past midterms and finals she gives you in order to do well. Don't recommend.

Good lecturer, but gives really basic examples in her notes. When it comes to her exams, it's a whole different level. You literally have to study off her answer keys. Textbook is useless, don't waste time and money buying/reading it.

Iryna is a really helpful prof, though Econ 103 is a challenging 100 level course, but she's always willing to answer questions and give out hints to make you think.  Exams are killers, but it's manageable; she literally covers every example so do the readings and pay attention to the concepts!  I would recommend this prof for any other econ course

This professor makes econ 103 hard. I took Econ 105 last semester and got a great mark. However, econ 103 was a different story. Her exams are hard. She doesn't give notes, you have to attend class and take your own note. But you can't barely understand what she is saying. Always uses examples. I would not take econ with this prof!

Your mark is based on 2 midterms worth 25% each, and a final exam worth 50%. Brutal exams. Not an easy course. TA is rude and discourages questions. Going to tutorial is not beneficial for this reason.

textbook not needed, only needed to look at notes given in lecture. midterm and final was okay as long as you understood most of the lectures, but written questions are tricky cause of the way she words them. class is curved anyways so it wasnt that bad

No use of technology. No powerpoint slides and doesnt use webct. Guess the school is cutting on costs and importing teachers from the 1990s. The textbook was useless, only necessary for tutorial questions (tutorial wasnt worth any marks). She was good at explaining, but had a bad attitude with students and was quite rude 1on1.

Haven't had a good experience with her. Seems to have a bad attitude towards students, Teaches at too slow of a pace, and she is also very unorganized. She also sent out practice midterms for us to study on, which was nice, but sent out an incomplete answer key, so for some questions I wasn't sure if I was doing them right..

She was a great prof. Her accent didnt bother me at all and all her lecture notes explained everything very well. The textbook was useless, only for tut Q. answers are given in tut, its not a must to go unless you plan to study off the tut Q for midterms. both midterms and final were fair, not that hard if you actually put some time into studying.

thoroughly enjoyed this class! everything was explained very clearly and although i wish TAs were more knowledgeable, i was still able to get a lot out of being in this class. the professor has a wonderful attitude towards teaching and tries to help you as much as possible. there are few readings and the difficulty level of the exams is reasonable.
Just make no sense

Dudnyk was an excellent professor!  I didn't have any problems with her accent; I guess if your not very good at english then you might find her accent tricky.  The textbook was was useless, you only need it for the tutorial questions; why? because her lectures teaches you everything you need for the exams.  Tutorials are helpful but not a must.
She's a professional prifessor.Even you havn't a book,she will write down all the detail in class.And she's nice.

She smiles a lot and before she moves on to something she always asks if its "crystal clear". All and all she really knows her stuff. The tests...its a disaster. The past exams she gives us gives opposite answers to the exam I did. For the written part, the TA's who mark it don't know English and cant help. Either you get 0/6 on a written Q or 6/6.
Awesome prof. Her notes are amazing and really you don't have to bother reading the textbook although it would help. She's really nice always smiling and really pretty. Course is killer though...

Shes one of the worst professor to try to come to an understanding with. I mean you can have a great answer to a question, like literally back it up with info and she will not give you the mark. Save yourself the trouble, and simply find a different professor for 103. She makes things a lot harder than it really is. And her TAs are  useless.
Class is hard and attending lectures and reading textbook are a must, but she is very nice, friendly and approachable.  She also always has a smile on her face very cute :)
Heard the final and MT is super tough,before u take this course I highly recommend u think about ur GPA .Its easy to get fail.

She is very approachable. If u get lost, just go to her office hours and ask questions! She will be glad to have you and discuss questions with you. Plus, her typed notes were very clear and organized.
Approachable. She keeps well-organized notes (the recommended book is helpful if you get lost in the lectures). She lets you know what's on the exam. MTs are fair, final is harder.

OK, she is not hot, but does have a pretty smile. MT1, MT2 and final are the same level of difficulty. Her notes are extremely unclear. It doesn't make sense at all, just go straight to the textbook. It'll clear up everything. her notes are not even in the textbook either. 3 outfits

If you want to hear what shes saying during lecture, sit in the first couple of rows. Midterms are fair, final is semi-hard. MT2 difficulty depends on your class average from the 1st MT. Very approachable, good prof and good class!

Excellent prof, don't bother with the textbook. Her notes are easy to understand and great, but you have to really understand them and not just skim them while reviewing to do well on the exams. Really receptive to students and feedback, love her!
notes were good, but reading the textbook is highly recommended. exams are hard.

Excellent Prof, helpful, clear, good explainer, ticks all the boxes. The TAs were awful so sometimes a mark or two were cut off in the exams. The exams were fair, maybe a bit hard. Take good notes and read them, those are all you need. The textbook was awful.

She's helpful when you wanna ask her some questions after lectures. And the notes she gave us are amazingly clear, maybe too clear for people. She tried her best to involve no math and calculus in the lectures. So in a word, good prof, kind person with shiny hairs...

She's really passionate about teaching, always smiling in class, and very engaging.  She gives out really structured notes, so attendance is important!  Most of the midterm MCs and some of the written questions are mainly based on her notes.  Midterms were fair and multiple choice was easier.  Her written questions are always harder, final = HARD!

She is very good at teaching the material. One of the best profs I have had at SFU. She is also very approachable and helpful to her students. You can tell she actually cares about her students understanding the material.Her exams are also very fair.
her notes are way too simplified because she assumes we don't understand it and then on test....no part marks for you and even if you wrote something she gave out as notes, marked wrong...
Although her accent was strong, i kinda liked her. Her notes were clear and she was smart. She was willing to help out students who were lost.

Lecture is boring but good to attend as her notes highlight important concepts. She may seem very nice, but only towards her more favored students. For the m/t, her ans. key had 1 question wrong, but she refused to make any changes because, and I quote, "It's scaled anyways." All-in-all, Dudnyk is a "okay" prof., but I'd never take her class again.
She is the best teacher ever! She is very helpful! Her notes are super clear! I love her very much! Take this course with her!!
Great Prof.  Clear with her notes and she's willing to clarify anything during her office hours.  She's definitely better than any other profs for teaching 103.

She has the mannerisms of an adolescent girl which is adorable. As for teaching, albeit the accent, she gets her points across making it understandable for people who pre-read the materials. Her exams, specifically the multiple choice questions, are tough. The class is scaled heavily where 50-60 represented a B- to B+ on the midterm.

The textbook is easy to read but you really need to do the practice questions and go to tutorials/office hours to get a good grasp on how to do the questions on assignments and midterms. It seems like a deceptively easy course but the average for the 1st MT was 50%. Her notes are excellent and she really tries to teach well
Hot bod lol

Generally nice, but likes to imply that the class is stupid when nobody answers in lecture (just shout out answers to keep things going). Can spend a whole class explaining high school math (ie. how to find a slope), which is frustrating. Notes are clear and fantastic. Exams are straightforward. Accent is quite thick, but totally understandable.

She is pretty nice and she can solve all your questions clearly when you ask her. But her final is SOOOO hard! The assignments are pretty easy but when it comes to exams you have no idea what are you writing about. Her Notes are very useful than the silly textbook.She is a good teacher after all.

She's an okay prof.She has a slight European accent,but is comprehensible.Her midterm was hard but her final exam was not too difficult.In fact,i think it was easier than her midterm exam.Assignments of course are easier compared to her exams.She's been teaching upper level courses, so her style of teaching is the same for lower division.

unfortunately i kind of hate her already :( she only has like 3 outfits and giggles/mumbles which makes her accent even worse. can't understand a thing she says. complicates simple concepts and has terrible notes. and really don't find her hot at all

Course was much too dense to be a 100-level course. Judging from previous comments, she's only been teaching 300-level courses in the past which hints at why her exams were so difficult. Assignments were way too easy in comparison to her actual midterm & final. She gives no useful hints for upcoming exams. My worst experience at SFU thus far.

for all those ppl who  think she sucks at teacher, I think she is GOOD. this class IS HARD. so the only reason why she teaches like we're stupid is because we WERE STUPID in the course. the MARKS even reflected our stupidity. and honestly, I LOVED HER NOTES. they were the MOST helpful. her exams were hard but thats because the COURSE ITSELF is hard
Not hot and has about the same 3 outfits. Treats her students like they're stupid and doesn't answer your questions with straight answers when you approach her. Exams very hard.

Well uh I didn't find her hot... She looks like a 40 years old with the body of a 20ish. The assignments are all right, but the exam's pretty hard, only eight people got above 80 I believe. However, she curves, so the grading is at the least a little better than Doug Allen's (From what I hear). She will help if you approach her though.

omg, the only reason i go to class is to see what she is wearing that day. the only reason i pay attention is b/c she is dam hot!!! really nice prof, she will photocopy you some lecture notes if you are away
